register.description: Sets internal Status Register

bitfield.description: assert INTA_N input. 0 = INTA_N input de-asserted 1 = INTA_N input asserted
Set parity error. 0 = No parity error detected 1 = Parity error detected
Set system error. 0 = No system error detected 1 = System error detected
Set master abort bit 0 = No master abort detected. 1 = Master abort detected
Set target abort bit 0 = No target abort detected 1 = Target abort detected

register.description: Clears internal Status Register

bitfield.description: Clear INTA_N input 0 = INTA_N input de-asserted 1 = INTA_N input asserted
Clear Parity error detected 0 = No parity error detected 1 = Parity error detected
Clear System error detected 0 = No system error detected 1 = System error detected
Clear Master abort detected 0 = No master abort detected. 1 = Master abort detected
Clear Target abort detected 0 = No target abort detected 1 = Target abort detected

register.description: Set internal Host Interrupt Enable Register

bitfield.description: Interrupt enable for PERR_Det
Interrupt enable for SERR_Det
Interrupt enable for Master_Abort_Det
Interrupt enable for Target_Abort_Det

register.description: Clear internal Host Interrupt Enable Register

bitfield.description: Clear Interrupt PERR_Det
Clear Interrupt SERR_Det
Clear Master abort detected
Clear Target abort detected

register.description: Set internal Back End Application Interrupt Enable Register

bitfield.description: Interrupt enable for INTA_In
Interrupt enable for PERR_Det
Interrupt enable for SERR_Det
Interrupt enable for Master_Abort_Det
Interrupt enable for Target_Abort_Det

register.description: Clear internal Back End Application Interrupt Enable Register

bitfield.description: Clear Interrupt INTA_In
Clear Interrupt PERR_Det
Clear Interrupt SERR_Det
Clear Master abort detected
Clear Target abort detected

register.description: This register is used to control clock management behaviors that are specific to the back end application and its interaction with the PCIIF

bitfield.description: This bit controls whether or not the PCIIF should always force the CLKRUN to stay asserted by reasserting CLKRUN whenever it is detected de-asserted
This bit controls whether or not the PCIIF should automatically re-assert CLKRUN

register.description: This register is used to initialize the Vendor ID and / or Device ID in the PCI Configuration Space

bitfield.description: Device ID. Identifies a specific device from the manufacturer. The Device ID is specified by the device manufacturer
Vendor ID.Uniquely identifies the manufacturer of the device. The Vendor ID is specified by the PCI Special Interest Group to insure uniqueness

register.description: This register is used to initialize certain bits in the PCI Configuration Space Command / Status register

bitfield.description: This bit is set by the PCIIF to indicate that it detected a parity error
This bit is set by the PCIIF to indicate that it signaled a system error on the SERR_N pin.
This bit is set by the PCI master unit in the PCIIF to indicate that it terminated a transaction with a master abort
This bit is set by the PCI master unit in the PCIIF to indicate that it has received a target abort when acting as a bus master
This bit is always 0 since the PCIIF cannot issue a target abort
This bit indicates the decode response time capability of the device

This bit is set by the PCI master unit in the PCIIF when all of the following conditions are met. 1.The PCIIF asserted PERR_N or observed PERR_N asserted 2.The PCIIF PCI master unit was the bus master during the observed PERR_N assertion 3. The Parity Error Response Bit is Set.
This bit indicates that the device is capable of performing fast back to back transactions
This bit indicates whether or not the interface is capable of meeting the 66MHz PCI
This bit indicates whether or not the interface provides at least one capabilities list
This bit indicates the current interrupt status for the function as generated by the interrupt registers in the back end interface.
This bit is a disable for the output driver on the INTA_N pin
This bit controls whether or not the device is allowed to perform back to back writes to different targets.
This bit is an enable for the output driver on the SERR_N pin
This bit controls whether or not the device responds to detected parity errors.
VGA Palette Snoop
This bit enables the device to use the Memory Write and Invalidate command.
This bit controls the device's response to special cycle commands
This bit enables the device to act as a PCI bus master
This bit enables the device to respond to memory accesses within it's address space
This bit enables the device to respond to I/O accesses within it's address space. If this bit is cleared, the PCIIF will not respond to IO mapped accesses

register.description: This register is used to initialize the Class Code and / or Revision ID

bitfield.description: Class Code. Identifies the generic and specific function and programming interface of the device. The Class Code is specified by the device manufacturer
Revision ID. Identifies a revision of the specific device. The Revision ID is specified by the device manufacturer

register.description: This register is used to set latency timer and cacheline size

bitfield.description: Hardwired to 0
Header Type. Identifies the layout of bytes 10h through 3Fh and if the device is single or multi-function
Latency Timer. The latency timer register is provided so that the host can restrict the continued usage of the PCI bus by a master involved in a multiple data cycle transaction.
Cacheline Size.This register is provided so that the host can inform the device of the cache line size in units of 32 bit words.

register.description: The Base Address Mask Registers control the size and prefetchability of the PCI Configuration Base Address Registers

bitfield.description: Address Mask Bit.These bits control the writability of corresponding bits in the corresponding PCI Configuration Base Address Register.
Prefetchable enable. This bit specifies whether or not the memory space controlled by the corresponding PCI Configruation Base Address Register is prefetchable.

register.description: The Base Address Mask Registers control the size and prefetchability of the PCI Configuration Base Address Registers

bitfield.description: Address Mask Bit.These bits control the writability of corresponding bits in the corresponding PCI Configuration Base Address Register.
Prefetchable enable. This bit specifies whether or not the memory space controlled by the corresponding PCI Configruation Base Address Register is prefetchable.

register.description: The Base Address Mask Registers control the size and prefetchability of the PCI Configuration Base Address Registers

bitfield.description: Address Mask Bit.These bits control the writability of corresponding bits in the corresponding PCI Configuration Base Address Register.
Prefetchable enable. This bit specifies whether or not the memory space controlled by the corresponding PCI Configruation Base Address Register is prefetchable.

register.description: The Base Address Mask Registers control the size and prefetchability of the PCI Configuration Base Address Registers

bitfield.description: Address Mask Bit.These bits control the writability of corresponding bits in the corresponding PCI Configuration Base Address Register.
Prefetchable enable. This bit specifies whether or not the memory space controlled by the corresponding PCI Configruation Base Address Register is prefetchable.

register.description: The Base Address Mask Registers control the size and prefetchability of the PCI Configuration Base Address Registers

bitfield.description: Address Mask Bit.These bits control the writability of corresponding bits in the corresponding PCI Configuration Base Address Register.
Prefetchable enable. This bit specifies whether or not the memory space controlled by the corresponding PCI Configruation Base Address Register is prefetchable.

register.description: The Base Address Mask Registers control the size and prefetchability of the PCI Configuration Base Address Registers

bitfield.description: Address Mask Bit.These bits control the writability of corresponding bits in the corresponding PCI Configuration Base Address Register.
Prefetchable enable. This bit specifies whether or not the memory space controlled by the corresponding PCI Configruation Base Address Register is prefetchable.

register.description: PCIIF Subsystem Vendor ID / Subsystem ID

bitfield.description: Subsystem Id. Identifies the board level device.The Subsystem ID is specified by the board level manufacturer.
Subsystem Vendor Id. Identifies the board level manufacturer. The Subsystem Vendor ID is specified by the PCI Special Interest Group.

register.description: Capabilities Pointer

bitfield.description: Capabilities Pointer. This constant specifies the address in configuration space where the first entry in the capabilities list is located.

register.description: Set Max Latency / Min Grant

bitfield.description: This specifies how often the device needs to gain access to the PCI bus in 0.25 micro sec units.
This specifies the length of the burst period for the device needs in 0.25 micro sec units.
This register tells which interrupt pin the device uses. This register is hardwired to a 01h in the PCIIF to indicate that interrupt A will be used.
The value in this 8 bit register is written by the host and indicates which input of the system interrupt controller the PCIIF interrupt pin is connected to.

register.description: PCIIF Slave Control

bitfield.description: Enable BASE 5 Config. 0 = Disable BASE 5 Config 1 = Enable BASE 5 Config
Enable BASE 4 Config 0 = Disable BASE 4 Config 1 = Enable BASE 4 Config
Enable BASE 3 Config 0 = Disable BASE 3 Config 1 = Enable BASE 3 Config
Enable BASE 2 Config 0 = Disable BASE 2 Config 1 = Enable BASE 2 Config
Enable BASE 1 Config 0 = Disable BASE 1 Config 1 = Enable BASE 1 Config
Enable BASE 0 Config 0 = Disable BASE 0 Config 1 = Enable BASE 0 Config

Force Delayed Read Multiple. 0 = Slave should respond with normal 16 clock cycle timeout and retry mechanism for Memory Read Multiple transactions 1 = Slave should immediately respond with a retry whenever a Memory Read Multiple transaction is decoded for this slave.

Force Delayed Read Line. 0 = Slave should respond with normal 16 clock cycle timeout and retry mechanism for Memory Read Line transactions 1 = Slave should immediately respond with a retry whenever a Memory Read Line transaction is decoded for this slave.

Force Delayed Read. 0 = Slave should respond with normal 16 clock cycle timeout and retry mechanism for Memory Read transactions 1 = Slave should immediately respond with a retry whenever a Memory Read transaction is decoded for this slave.
Disable Slave timeout. 0 = Slave responds with normal 16 clock cycle timeout mechanism 1 = Slave will insert wait states on the PCI Bus indefinitely until the access is ready to complete

Indicates if the Configuration Registers have been loaded with their proper reset values: 0 = Configuration Registers are being loaded. No access allowed into PCI interface. 1 = Configuration Registers loading is complete. PCI interface will accept accesses.

register.description: This register control the translation of transaction addresses

bitfield.description: This is the address that is to bitwise replace the slave transaction address.This is multiplexed on a bitwise basis with the original PCI address using the corresponding PCIIF Base Address Mask register bits 31:4 as the multiplexer select.

register.description: This register control the translation of transaction addresses

bitfield.description: This is the address that is to bitwise replace the slave transaction address.This is multiplexed on a bitwise basis with the original PCI address using the corresponding PCIIF Base Address Mask register bits 31:4 as the multiplexer select.

register.description: This register control the translation of transaction addresses

bitfield.description: This is the address that is to bitwise replace the slave transaction address.This is multiplexed on a bitwise basis with the original PCI address using the corresponding PCIIF Base Address Mask register bits 31:4 as the multiplexer select.

register.description: This register control the translation of transaction addresses

bitfield.description: This is the address that is to bitwise replace the slave transaction address.This is multiplexed on a bitwise basis with the original PCI address using the corresponding PCIIF Base Address Mask register bits 31:4 as the multiplexer select.

register.description: This register control the translation of transaction addresses

bitfield.description: This is the address that is to bitwise replace the slave transaction address.This is multiplexed on a bitwise basis with the original PCI address using the corresponding PCIIF Base Address Mask register bits 31:4 as the multiplexer select.

register.description: This register control the translation of transaction addresses

bitfield.description: This is the address that is to bitwise replace the slave transaction address.This is multiplexed on a bitwise basis with the original PCI address using the corresponding PCIIF Base Address Mask register bits 31:4 as the multiplexer select.

register.description: PCIIF Base Address Mirror Register

bitfield.description: These bits can be written by the host in order to allow initialization of the base address at startup
This bit specifies whether or not the memory space controlled by this base address register is prefetchable
These bits indicate the size of the base address register
This bit indicates whether the base address maps into the host's memory or I/O space

register.description: PCIIF Base Address Mirror Register

bitfield.description: These bits can be written by the host in order to allow initialization of the base address at startup
This bit specifies whether or not the memory space controlled by this base address register is prefetchable
These bits indicate the size of the base address register
This bit indicates whether the base address maps into the host's memory or I/O space

bitfield.description: These bits can be written by the host in order to allow initialization of the base address at startup
This bit specifies whether or not the memory space controlled by this base address register is prefetchable
These bits indicate the size of the base address register
This bit indicates whether the base address maps into the host's memory or I/O space

bitfield.description: These bits can be written by the host in order to allow initialization of the base address at startup

This bit indicates whether the base address maps into the host's memory or I/O space

bitfield.description: These bits can be written by the host in order to allow initialization of the base address at startup
This bit specifies whether or not the memory space controlled by this base address register is prefetchable

This bit indicates whether the base address maps into the host's memory or I/O space

register.description: PCIIF Base Address Mirror Register

bitfield.description: These bits can be written by the host in order to allow initialization of the base address at startup

This bit indicates whether the base address maps into the host's memory or I/O space

register.description: PCIIF Master Configuration / IO Access Data Register

bitfield.description: Software writes the data into this register bit for a configuration/IO write, or reads the data from this register for a configuration/IO read.

register.description: PCIIF Master Configuration / IO Access Address Register

bitfield.description: Address for Configuration/IO Transaction. Bits 1:0 are ignored for a Configuration Transaction. Software must ensure that Bits 1:0 of the Address correspond to the Byte_Enables that are written in the Configuration / IO Access Command register for IO transactions to ensure that the access is legal on the PCI bus.

register.description: PCIIF Master Configuration / IO Access Command Register

bitfield.description: The ready bit should be checked to assure previous transaction is complete
Byte Enables
Set Configuration and IO Transaction 0 = Configuration Transaction 1 = IO Transaction
Set read and write operation 0 = Write 1 = Read

register.description: PCIIF Master Configuration Register

bitfield.description: Controls whether or not the Master will flush Configuration transactions from the proxyregisters if the Master is not enabled
Controls whether or not the Master will flush I/O transactions from the proxy registers if the Master is not enabled
Controls whether or not the Master will flush transactions on the pcim interface if the Master is not enabled
Controls whether or not the Master command generation logic is permitted to use the Memory Read Multiple command
Controls whether or not the Master command generation logic is permitted to use the Memory Read Line command
Controls whether or not the Master command generation logic is permitted to use the Memory Write and Invalidate command

bitfield.description: Substitutes the 9 MSBs of VBUS address
